poem:
Title: The Echo of Unlearned Lessons

Echoes in the hallways, headmaster's ghastly song,
To inflict, Inscribe 'lesson' on the pristine innocent throng.
A rite in the school of order, the discord of thrall,
First a boy, then a symbol, under order's fall.
No pleasure in his beat, bitter taste of the past,
The first and last to meet, the echo of the lash lasts.
